input_text:
Job Title: Client Implementation Associate, State Street Global Advisors, Officer

Location: Boston, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork â€“ the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

The Client Implementation Officer Will Lead The Planning, Coordination And Execution Of Client And Product Events At State Street Global Advisors (SSGA) Across Multiple Global Regions Including

Client fundings for separate accounts and commingled fundsClient mandate changesLaunching of company sponsored ETFs, Mutual Funds, Seed Funds and Commingled productsClient and Fund liquidations and terminationsIn-kind contributions and withdrawalsCustodian and Recordkeeper changesContractual review including comments and approvalsEngage the organization ensuring that all appropriate parties and functional groups are informed, involved, and in asset structuring processesThis includes the evaluation of the complexity, fund structures, special requirements, and risks associated with each eventWork with Relationship Managers, Product Development and Investment teams to clearly articulate event requirement and solicit input as neededMake adjustments to plan and execution, depending on external needs and internal business policies and standardsParticipate in or lead projects aimed at continually improving the firm's overall business processesOwn, along with the Investment team, the process of implementing a client event from an investment perspective

Requirements

Minimum 8 years experience in the investment management field with specific focus on investment operations and investment experienceDeep understanding of complex investment issues, processes and vehicles and how these relate to client eventsStrong desire to continuously improve industry and investment knowledgeStrong project management skillsExcellent interpersonal, time management and execution skills such as prioritization and multi-tasking under time constraintsAbility to build and maintain professional relationships with clients, internal teams, consultants custodians and transition managers, and optimally interact with all levels of an organizationAbility to take a leadership role in the decision-making process and bringing parties to a consensusStrong business discernment, including the ability to synthesize complex issues and optimally balance substantial objectivesStrong analytical skills and the ability of understanding client objectives and developing effective and appropriate solutions to meet those objectivesConsistent track record of successfully leading client eventsExcellent written & verbal communications and presentation skillsGreat teammate with a positive attitudeBachelor's Degree required

Are you the right candidate? Yes!

We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don't necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.

About State Street Global Advisors

What We Do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world's governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world's largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care.

Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. We are driven by a desire to help our clients, and those who rely on them, achieve a better future. We have a long history of developing innovative investment strategies to provide our clients with reliable and transparent returns, cost-effectively, and without excessive risk.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street Global Advisors State Street is an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability.

Salary Range

$65,000 - $102,500 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Client Implementation Associate, State Street Global Advisors, Officer
output_json.summary: A full-time position at State Street Global Advisors requiring 8 years of experience in investment management, focusing on investment operations and investment experience.
optional_skills: Deep understanding of complex investment issues, processes and vehicles
Excellent interpersonal, time management and execution skills
Ability to build and maintain professional relationships
Consistent track record of successfully leading client events
Excellent written & verbal communications and presentation skills
Great teammate with a positive attitude
job_responsibilities: Lead planning, coordination, and execution of client and product events across multiple global regions
Manage client fundings for separate accounts and commingled funds
Launch company-sponsored ETFs, Mutual Funds, Seed Funds, and Commingled products
Handle client and fund liquidations and terminations
Participate in or lead projects to improve business processes
Evaluate complexity, fund structures, special requirements, and risks associated with each event
Engage with Relationship Managers, Product Development, and Investment teams
Articulate event requirements and solicit input
Adjust plans and execution based on external needs and internal policies
Maintain professional relationships with various stakeholders
Take a leadership role in decision-making and consensus-building
Apply strong business discernment and analytical skills
Synthesize complex issues and balance objectives
Develop effective solutions to meet client objectives
Communicate effectively in writing and verbally
benefits: Competitive medical care, insurance, and savings plans
Tools for balancing professional and personal life
output_json.company_information: State Street Global Advisors is the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, serving governments, institutions, and financial advisors for over four decades. Known for its rigorous, risk-aware approach, they offer active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. They prioritize responsible investing to enable economic prosperity and social progress.
